page.title: 09 Childer Thornton Farm
page.content: {Childer Thornton Farm}consists of 350 acres. It is a mixed farm which means that the farmer grows crops and has cattle for both dairy production and beef. The farm, although it is mixed, is mainly dairy, with 100 head of British Friesian cattle. The cattle themselves weigh 500kg to 600kg. When first born, the calves are taken away from their mother and are fed 6 litres of their mothers rich milk which gives them immunity. When they are 4 days they are fed a special food called quicklettes. After 7 days the calves are able to drink water. The farm also has 3 pet lambs, a cross between Suffolk and Cheviot. The farm uses peas,rye, vetches and barley for silage which is fed to the cattle in winter.
